Sentencas: The outermost surface of the yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte in the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) plays a dominant role in the performance of the cell.
Titulo: Discovery of the rate limiting step in solid oxide fuel cells by LEIS

Sentencas: Low energy ion scattering is the only technique, which is capable of studying exactly that surface.
Titulo: Discovery of the rate limiting step in solid oxide fuel cells by LEIS

Sentencas: Instead of Y2O3, impurities segregated to the outermost surface until it was completely covered by them.
Titulo: Discovery of the rate limiting step in solid oxide fuel cells by LEIS

Sentencas: This strong impurity segregation was proven characteristic for any YSZ sample.
Titulo: Discovery of the rate limiting step in solid oxide fuel cells by LEIS

Sentencas: The performance of the SOFC will therefore be completely determined by these impurities.
Titulo: Discovery of the rate limiting step in solid oxide fuel cells by LEIS

Sentencas: Y2O3 did segregate to the subsurface layer and a difference in interfacial free energies between Y2O3 and ZrO2 of 21 +/- 3 kJ/mol was determined.
Titulo: Discovery of the rate limiting step in solid oxide fuel cells by LEIS

Sentencas: So what normally is explained Lis surface segregation is in fact subsurface segregation, which also explains the higher Y2O3, concentration measured in this study compared to literature.
Titulo: Discovery of the rate limiting step in solid oxide fuel cells by LEIS
